headline: Caramelized Onion Pasta
name: Caramelized Onion Pasta
description: This caramelized onion pasta is a new and really different pasta dish that just might become your new favorite. Sun-dried tomatoes and chili onion crunch add a new dimension to rich, silky caramelized onions, and the result is both elegant and worth the effort.
recipeIngredient: 3 large onions, halved and thinly sliced
1 1/2 tablespoons chili onion crunch (such as Trader Joe’s®) or more to taste
salt and freshly-ground black pepper to taste
garnish with chopped fresh parsley and grated Parmesan cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Stir in onions until well coated. Cook, stirring occasionally, until they start to caramelize and turn golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes. You can add water, 1 tablespoon at a time, as onion mixture cooks to speed up caramelization and keep onions moist.
Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in sun-dried tomatoes, soy sauce, chili onion crunch, and season with salt and pepper.

Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook spaghetti in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup pasta water.

Transfer pasta to the skillet with caramelized onions. Toss everything together until well coated, and stir in remaining tablespoon of butter. Add reserved pasta water, if needed, a tablespoon at a time.
Garnish with chopped parsley and Parmesan cheese, and serve.
